contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=August 2009}} <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Josceline Percy.jpg|thumb|Charles Paulet]] --> '''Charles Paulet, 1st Duke of Bolton''', [[Privy Council of England|PC]] (c. 1625 – 27 February 1699), son of [[John Paulet, 5th Marquess of Winchester]]. He became the sixth [[Marquess of Winchester]] on his father's death in 1675, was [[Member of Parliament]] (MP) for [[Winchester (UK Parliament constituency)|Winchester]] and then for [[Hampshire (UK Parliament constituency)|Hampshire]] from 1660 to 1675. Before his accession to the Marquessate he was styled '''Lord St John'''.<ref>[[George Edward Cokayne]], ed. [[Vicary Gibbs (MP)|Vicary Gibbs]], ''[[The Complete Peerage]]'', vol. II, p. 211, The St Catherine Press, London, 1912</ref> Having supported the claim of [[William III of England|William]] and [[Mary II of England|Mary]] to the English throne in 1688, he was restored to the [[Privy Council of England|Privy Council]] and to the office of [[Lord Lieutenant of Hampshire]], and was created [[Duke of Bolton]] in April 1689. He built [[Bolton Hall, North Yorkshire]] in 1678.<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.britishlistedbuildings.co.uk/en-321801-bolton-hall-preston-under-scar-north-yor|title= Bolton Hall, Preston-under-Scar|publisher= British Listed Buildings|accessdate = 2013-02-03}}</ref> An eccentric man, hostile to [[George Savile, 1st Marquess of Halifax|Lord Halifax]] and afterwards to the [[John Churchill, 1st Duke of Marlborough|Duke of Marlborough]], he is said to have travelled during 1687 with four coaches and 100 horsemen, sleeping during the day and giving entertainments at night. By his wife Mary, the natural daughter of [[Emanuel Scrope, 1st Earl of Sunderland]], he had six children: *[[Charles Paulet, 2nd Duke of Bolton]] (1661–1722) *[[Lord William Powlett]] (c.1667–1729) *Lady Jane Paulet (d. c.1715), married on 2 April 1673 [[John Egerton, 3rd Earl of Bridgwater]] *Lady Elizabeth Paulet, married Toby Jenkins *Lord Thomas Paulet (d.
